info.title: Agent Engine API
info.summary: Airbyte's Agent Engine API retrieves data on behalf of your customers and feeds it to your agentic workflows.
info.description:
This is the public API documentation for Airbyte's Agent Engine. Use the API to manage authentication, connectors, and customers, and power their agentic workflows.

If you are a member of multiple Agent Engine organizations, add the `X-Organization-Id: organization's UUID` header to your requests. It specifies which organization you are making requests to. If you only belong to one organization, you don't need to set this header.

The API contains several types of endpoints.

- Authentication: Generate tokens to make other API requests.
- Connectors: Create and manage end-user connectors, and execute operations with connectors.
- Customers: manage customer workspaces and retrieve workspace statistics.
- Data replication: configure connection templates and destination definitions for data replication use cases.

Some endpoints are separated into Advanced categories. These endpoints are more specialized and should not be required for day-to-day use of the API.

post.description:
**Requires an Access Token as the bearer token.**

Generate a new scoped token.

You can safely share it with your end users and it will allow them to manage their configured sources.

put.description:
Create or update OAuth credentials for the user's organization.

This endpoint:
1. Extracts organization_id from the user's token
2. Validates the configuration against the connector's OAuth spec
3. Stores secrets and replaces them with secret coordinates
4. Proxies the credentials to Coral's organization OAuth endpoint
5. Saves the record to Sonar's database

parameters.name: x-organization-id

schema.description: The organization ID to target for this request
schema.title: X-Organization-Id

parameters.description: The organization ID to target for this request

delete.description:
Delete OAuth credentials for the user's organization.

Deletes from Airbyte first, then soft-deletes the local record.
Idempotent: returns 204 even if no record exists.

schema.description: The organization ID to target for this request
schema.title: X-Organization-Id

get.description:
List external users for the authenticated organization with cursor-based pagination.

- **name_contains**: Optional filter by external user name (case-insensitive partial match)
- **status**: Optional filter by external user status (active or inactive). If not specified, returns all external users.
- **limit**: Maximum number of external users to return (default: 20, max: 100)
- **cursor**: Pagination cursor from previous response's `next` URL
- **next**: URL for next page (null if no more results)

parameters.name: name_contains

schema.description: Filter external users by name (case-insensitive partial match)

schema.description: Filter external users by status (active or inactive). Returns all if not specified.

schema.description: Maximum number of external users to return
schema.title: Limit

parameters.description: Maximum number of external users to return

schema.description: Opaque pagination cursor

put.description:
Update an external user's name, status, and/or cache setting.
- Set `name` to update the external user name
- Set `status` to 'active' or 'inactive' to change the external user status
- When setting status to 'inactive', all active connections for the external user will be automatically disabled
- Set `cache_enabled` to true/false to enable or disable Context Store caching for this external user

AirbyteHostedConnectionTemplate.title: AirbyteHostedConnectionTemplate
AirbyteHostedConnectionTemplate.description: Connection template where destination configuration is managed by Airbyte.

data_hosting_type.title: Data Hosting Type
data_hosting_type.description: The hosting type. 'airbyte_hosted' means destination config is auto-populated with Airbyte-managed S3.

cron_expression.title: Cron Expression
cron_expression.description: A valid Quartz cron expression describing the schedule for the connection.

AirbyteHostedConnectionTemplateCreateReq.title: AirbyteHostedConnectionTemplateCreateRequest
AirbyteHostedConnectionTemplateCreateReq.description: Create request for Airbyte-hosted connection templates where destination configuration is auto-populated.

ConnectorExecuteRequest.title: ConnectorExecuteRequest
ConnectorExecuteRequest.description:
Request body for connector execution.

All actions use the same unified format:
    - entity: resource type or stream name
    - action: operation type (list, get, create, download, search, api_search)
    - params: operation-specific parameters

For SEARCH action, params should contain:
    - query: Query object with filter/sort conditions
    - limit: maximum number of results (default 10)
    - cursor: pagination cursor for next page
    - fields: list of field paths to include in results

ConnectorExecuteResponse.title: ConnectorExecuteResponse
ConnectorExecuteResponse.description: Standardized response envelope for connector execution.

customer_name.title: Customer Name
customer_name.description: Customer name (maps to workspace name). Previously named external_user_id.

definition_id.title: Definition Id
definition_id.description: Actor definition ID for the connector.

source_template_id.title: Source Template Id
source_template_id.description: Source template ID. Optional when only one template exists for the connector type. Required when multiple templates exist for the same connector type.

replication_config.title: Replication Config
replication_config.description: The configuration for the replication connector. For REPLICATION mode, this is the full config. For MULTI/DIRECT mode, this can contain replication-specific settings like start_date, lookback_window, etc. that will be merged with credentials and environment. At least one of replication_config, credentials, or server_side_oauth_secret_id must be provided.

credentials.title: Credentials
credentials.description: Authentication configuration for the source. Required for DIRECT/MULTI mode sources. At least one of replication_config, credentials, or server_side_oauth_secret_id must be provided.

environment.title: Environment
environment.description: User-provided configuration for the source. Used for DIRECT/MULTI mode sources (can be empty dict).

server_side_oauth_secret_id.title: Server Side Oauth Secret Id
server_side_oauth_secret_id.description: OAuth secret ID obtained from the initiateOAuth redirect callback. When provided, credentials are not required as OAuth handles authentication.

selected_connection_template_tags.title: Selected Connection Template Tags
selected_connection_template_tags.description: Optional list of tags to filter which connection templates will be used for this source.

selected_connection_template_tags_mode.description: Tag selection mode for connection templates: 'all' (must have all tags) or 'any' (must have at least one tag). Defaults to 'any'.

ConnectorSourceCheckConfigRequest.title: ConnectorSourceCheckConfigRequest
ConnectorSourceCheckConfigRequest.description: Request model for checking connector source configuration before creation.

replication_config.title: Replication Config
replication_config.description: The configuration for the replication connector.

ConnectorSourceCheckConfigUpdateRequest.title: ConnectorSourceCheckConfigUpdateRequest
ConnectorSourceCheckConfigUpdateRequest.description: Request model for checking connector source configuration before update.

customer_name.title: Customer Name
customer_name.description: Customer name (maps to workspace name). Previously named external_user_id.

definition_id.title: Definition Id
definition_id.description: Actor definition ID for the connector.

source_template_id.title: Source Template Id
source_template_id.description: Source template ID. Optional when only one template exists for the connector type. Required when multiple templates exist for the same connector type.

replication_config.title: Replication Config
replication_config.description: The configuration for the replication connector. For REPLICATION mode, this is the full config. For MULTI/DIRECT mode, this can contain replication-specific settings like start_date, lookback_window, etc. that will be merged with credentials and environment. At least one of replication_config, credentials, or server_side_oauth_secret_id must be provided.

credentials.title: Credentials
credentials.description: Authentication configuration for the source. Required for DIRECT/MULTI mode sources. At least one of replication_config, credentials, or server_side_oauth_secret_id must be provided.

environment.title: Environment
environment.description: User-provided configuration for the source. Used for DIRECT/MULTI mode sources (can be empty dict).

server_side_oauth_secret_id.title: Server Side Oauth Secret Id
server_side_oauth_secret_id.description: OAuth secret ID obtained from the initiateOAuth redirect callback. When provided, credentials are not required as OAuth handles authentication.

selected_connection_template_tags.title: Selected Connection Template Tags
selected_connection_template_tags.description: Optional list of tags to filter which connection templates will be used for this source.

selected_connection_template_tags_mode.description: Tag selection mode for connection templates: 'all' (must have all tags) or 'any' (must have at least one tag). Defaults to 'any'.

ConnectorSourceCreateRequest.title: ConnectorSourceCreateRequest
ConnectorSourceCreateRequest.description:
Request model for creating a connector source.

Uses `replication_config` instead of `source_config` for clearer semantics.
For REPLICATION mode: pass the full config in `replication_config`
For MULTI/DIRECT mode: pass `credentials` + `environment` + optional `replication_config` overrides
For OAuth: pass `secret_id` from OAuth callback instead of credentials

replication_config.title: Replication Config
replication_config.description: The configuration for the replication connector.

cron_expression.title: Cron Expression
cron_expression.description: A Quartz cron expression to be described

description.title: Description
description.description: Human-readable description of the cron expression

is_valid.title: Is Valid
is_valid.description: Whether the cron expression is valid

customization.description:
Customizations for the source template. If stream_whitelist is provided, only the specified streams will be synced.
If stream_customizations are provided, and stream fields specified will override the default settings for only that
field. Where any streams fields are not specified, the default settings will be used.

EncryptionMapper.title: EncryptionMapper
EncryptionMapper.description:
Encryption mapper - encrypts sensitive fields with RSA.

Encrypts specified fields using RSA public key encryption. The encrypted
values replace the original field values in the output stream.

Note: Only RSA encryption is supported. AES is not available due to
secrets hydration issues in the Airbyte platform.

public_key.title: Public Key
public_key.description: RSA public key in PEM format

EncryptionMapperConfig.title: EncryptionMapperConfig
EncryptionMapperConfig.description:
Configuration for encryption mapper - uses snake_case.

Encrypts a specified field using RSA (OAEP-SHA256). The encrypted value
replaces the original field value or is emitted with the configured suffix.

NOTE: Symmetric AES is NOT supported in this API.

Why we don't support AES:
- Secrets hydration for AES mappers is not currently supported in the platform
- AES requires symmetric key management which doesn't align well with
  Sonar's secrets management architecture
- RSA with public keys is more appropriate for this use case as it
  allows encryption without exposing private keys in the configuration

If you need AES encryption, this must be resolved at the platform level
with proper secrets storage and hydration support before we can add it here.

direct.title: Direct
direct.description: Questions answerable via direct API operations (list, get, download)

external_message.title: External Message
external_message.description: User-friendly error message suitable for display

FailureReason.title: FailureReason
FailureReason.description:
Structured failure information from Coral API.
Contains details about why a check or operation failed.

FailureType.title: FailureType
FailureType.description: Categorizes well known errors into types for programmatic handling.

FieldFilteringMapper.title: FieldFilteringMapper
FieldFilteringMapper.description:
Field filtering mapper - removes a specific field from each record.

Filters out a single specified field from the data stream. The targeted
field is removed from all records in the output stream.

Note: This currently supports removing a single field (denylist approach).
To support allowlist filtering (keeping only specified fields), the config
would need to be extended with an allowed_fields list instead of target_field.

FieldFilteringMapperConfig.title: FieldFilteringMapperConfig
FieldFilteringMapperConfig.description:
Configuration for field filtering mapper - uses snake_case.

Filters out a specific field from the data stream.

FieldRenamingMapper.title: FieldRenamingMapper
FieldRenamingMapper.description:
Field renaming mapper - renames a single field per configuration.

Renames one field in the data stream (original_field_name  new_field_name).
Useful for standardizing field names across different data sources.

FieldRenamingMapperConfig.title: FieldRenamingMapperConfig
FieldRenamingMapperConfig.description:
Configuration for field renaming mapper - uses snake_case.

Renames a single field in the data stream.

HashingMapper.title: HashingMapper
HashingMapper.description:
Hashing mapper - converts field values to cryptographic hashes.

Applies a hash function (SHA256, SHA512, or MD5) to transform field values.
Can either replace the original field or create a new field with a suffix.

field_name_suffix.title: Field Name Suffix
field_name_suffix.description: Optional suffix for new field with hashed value

HashingMapperConfig.title: HashingMapperConfig
HashingMapperConfig.description:
Configuration for hashing mapper - uses snake_case.

Transforms a field value by applying a cryptographic hash function.
The original field is replaced with the hashed value, or a new field
can be created with a suffix.

oauth_user_input_from_connector_config_s.title: Oauth User Input From Connector Config Specification

connector_definition_id.title: Connector Definition Id
connector_definition_id.description: Actor definition ID for the connector.

OAuthCredentialsRequest.title: OAuthCredentialsRequest
OAuthCredentialsRequest.description:
Request body for creating/updating OAuth credentials.

Uses the same connector identification pattern as other endpoints:
exactly one of connector_type or connector_definition_id must be provided.

For operator endpoint: scope_type and scope_id are determined from the token.
For admin endpoint: scope_type is always 'global' and scope_id is NULL.

OAuthCredentialsResponse.title: OAuthCredentialsResponse
OAuthCredentialsResponse.description:
Response body for OAuth credentials.

Note: configuration is NOT returned for security reasons.

RowFilterCondition.title: RowFilterCondition
RowFilterCondition.description: Condition for row filtering - uses snake_case.

RowFilteringMapper-Input.title: RowFilteringMapper
RowFilteringMapper-Input.description:
Row filtering mapper - filters rows based on field equality.

Only keeps rows where a specific field equals a given value. Rows that
don't match the condition are excluded from the output.

RowFilteringMapper-Output.title: RowFilteringMapper
RowFilteringMapper-Output.description:
Row filtering mapper - filters rows based on field equality.

Only keeps rows where a specific field equals a given value. Rows that
don't match the condition are excluded from the output.

RowFilteringMapperConfig.title: RowFilteringMapperConfig
RowFilteringMapperConfig.description:
Configuration for row filtering mapper - uses snake_case.

Filters rows based on a condition. Only rows where the specified field
equals the provided value are kept.

customer_name.title: Customer Name
customer_name.description: Customer name (workspace name). Previously named external_user_id.

partial_default_config.title: Partial Default Config
partial_default_config.description: A template configuration containing default values for all those fields that the end user will *not* provide. Personalized fields like resource names or secrets should not be provided here.

customization.description:
Customizations for the source template. If stream_whitelist is provided, only the specified streams will be synced.
If stream_customizations are provided, and stream fields specified will override the default settings for only that
field. Where any streams fields are not specified, the default settings will be used.

destination_definition_id.description: The id of the destination definition (type of destination connector) to use for the connection.

destination_config.title: Destination Config
destination_config.description: The configuration for the destination connector. Must match the destination definition.

cron_expression.title: Cron Expression
cron_expression.description: A valid Quartz cron expression describing the schedule for the connection.

non_breaking_changes_preference.description: The action Airbyte should take when breaking changes are made to a source schema.

sync_on_create.title: Sync On Create
sync_on_create.description: Whether to start a sync job when the connection is created.

UserHostedConnectionTemplateCreateReques.title: UserHostedConnectionTemplateCreateRequest
UserHostedConnectionTemplateCreateReques.description: Create request for user-hosted connection templates where the user provides destination configuration.

customer_name.title: Customer Name
customer_name.description: Customer name (workspace name). Previously named external_user_id.

region_id.title: Region Id
region_id.description: The region in which to create the workspace. If not provided, the default US region will be used. US region: 645a183f-b12b-4c6e-8ad3-99e165603450, EU region: b9e48d61-f082-4a14-a8d0-799a907938cb.

customer_name.title: Customer Name
customer_name.description: Customer name (workspace name). Previously named external_user_id.

region_id.title: Region Id
region_id.description: The region in which to create the workspace. If not provided, the default US region will be used. US region: 645a183f-b12b-4c6e-8ad3-99e165603450, EU region: b9e48d61-f082-4a14-a8d0-799a907938cb.

allowed_origin.title: Allowed Origin
allowed_origin.description: The allowed origin for the widget.

selected_source_template_tags.title: Selected Source Template Tags
selected_source_template_tags.description: Optional list of tags to filter which source templates will be available in the widget.

selected_source_template_tags_mode.description: Tag selection mode for source templates: 'all' (must have all tags) or 'any' (must have at least one tag). Defaults to 'any'.

selected_connection_template_tags.title: Selected Connection Template Tags
selected_connection_template_tags.description: Optional list of tags to filter which connection templates will be available in the widget.

selected_connection_template_tags_mode.description: Tag selection mode for connection templates: 'all' (must have all tags) or 'any' (must have at least one tag). Defaults to 'any'.
